name: Bass Players in the Music World Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the bass player for The Who?
questions.explanation:
John Entwistle.

	One of the pioneers of rock bass, John Entwistle was with The Who for over 38 years.  He died in 2002, a day before The Who started touring. Pino Palladino filled in for John Entwistle and did an excellent job on such short notice.

questions.text: The bass player for The Rolling Stones?
questions.explanation:
Bill Wyman.

	Bill Wyman left The Rolling Stones in December of 1992.  The Stones still haven't found a permanent replacement for him.

questions.text: Who played the bass for AC/DC?
questions.explanation:
Cliff Williams.

	Cliff Williams has been with AC/DC since 1977.  Mark Evans played bass on their first album "High Voltage".

Tom Hamilton.

	Tom Hamilton has been with Aerosmith since they started in 1970.

Roger Waters & Waters.

	Roger Waters has been with Pink Floyd since they began back in 1967 with their first single "Arnold Layne". Roger Waters left the band in the mid 80s to pursue a successful solo career.

questions.text: Who was the bass player for Deep Purple after Nick Simper?
questions.explanation:
Roger Glover.

	Roger Glover has been with Deep Purple since 1969. The original bass player for Deep Purple was Nick Simper who recorded three albums with them.

John Paul Jones & Jones & John.

	John Paul Jones was with Led Zeppelin since their beginning in 1968.  Keith Moon, the late great drummer for The Who, is credited with giving Led Zeppelin their name.

Terry "Geezer" Butler.

	Geezer Butler was the founding member of Black Sabbath.  They started out as the group Earth until they saw a poster for a Boris Karloff movie called "Black Sabbath".  Ozzy was the last to join Black Sabbath and the first to leave.

Chris Squire.

	Chris Squire was the co-founder of Yes which began in 1968.

questions.text: The original bass player for The Beatles was?
questions.explanation:
Stu Sutcliffe.

	Stu Sutcliffe left The Beatles after playing a gig in Hamburg, Germany.  Paul McCartney was playing piano at the time and filled in as bass player after Sutcliffe left.
